pros: Lots of learning involved and opportunities for growth
cons: Can be odd hours so you need good time management.

pros: SVAD Productions is relatively new but has already created some outstanding works. The people are very friendly and everyone has a great eye for design.
cons: Like I said the company is new...They are still getting a feel for things and boy does it show. The way it works now is that other companies hire SVAD to create their projects. I have worked on about four different projects for SVAD over the coarse of 6 months. I am often told out of the blue that a new project was picked up for an insane deadline. And as friendly as my employers are, they seem to be a bit scatterbrained. Important deadlines are often missed due to lack of direction and last minute planning. If one is to work with the animation department, expect to be extremely self-motivated. Most of  the creative meetings I had to illicit myself. Also, expect to be paid every now and again if you are a current student at the school.

review_title: Working for SAU has been a wonderful and growing experience.
pros: Supervisors are will to work with a students class schedule in order to make working for a particular department optimal. Supervisors also challenge students to grow in new ways everyday in every department. Even if a student is just a general labor for a given department, each is treated as a highly valued asset.
cons: There are no real "cons" that are solely enforced by or drawn up by SAU per se. My only discrepancy is the limit to the number of total hours a student can work on campus due to the Affordable Care Act.

pros: As an adjunct and then later an assistant professor I had the opportunity to be part of the team in the School of Education and Psychology. My supervisors were great and the office staff were incredibly supportive and helpful. I was given a lot of freedom to develop my curriculum.
cons: Having to both teach and be an academic advisor created a lot of extra stress. At times the environment was a little restrictive.

pros:
*positive work environment
*willing to work with you and your class schedule
*friendly bosses

I was a TA for a class I had already taken so it was like having a refresher course while getting paid :)
cons:
Working with students can be difficult sometimes...We all have bad days so it's understandable, but some individuals are tougher than others.
Pay is not much above minimum wage, but it's a college campus so I wasn't expecting more.

pros: This Job is convenient for me because I am able to go to school and work, which is a great benefit for. I am also able to meet new people everyday which I enjoy doing and helping them out in whatever they need.
cons: I would not say there is much downside, but sometimes I have to work night shifts which can be hard for me because I have class early in the morning, but other than that this is a great job.

review_title: I love working for a company that has a clear purpose and mission. I also enjoy working at a company that is spiritual.
